alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties through 345 PM MDT/445 PM CDT/... At 319 PM MDT/419 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Tribune, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Wichita and southeastern Greeley Counties, including the following locations... Selkirk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
